dt: {bc}to speak or write (a passage) from another usually with credit acknowledgment
{bc}to repeat a passage from especially in substantiation or illustration
{bc}to state (the current price or bid-offer spread) for a commodity, stock, or bond
{bc}to inform a hearer or reader that matter following is {a_link|quoted}

et: Medieval Latin {it}quotare{/it} to mark the number of, number references, from Latin {it}quotus{/it} of what number or quantity, from {it}quot{/it} how many, (as) many as; akin to Latin {it}qui{/it} who {ma}{mat|who|}{/ma}
shortdef: to speak or write (a passage) from another usually with credit acknowledgment
to repeat a passage from especially in substantiation or illustration

dt: often used orally to indicate the beginning of a direct quotation

shortdef: quotation mark —often used orally to indicate the beginning of a direct quotation

dt: {bc}a gesture made by raising and flexing the index and middle fingers of both hands that is used to call attention to a spoken word or expression

shortdef: a gesture made by raising and flexing the index and middle fingers of both hands that is used to call attention to a spoken word or expression

dt: {bc}quotation marks used to express especially skepticism or derision concerning the use of the enclosed word or phrase

shortdef: quotation marks used to express especially skepticism or derision concerning the use of the enclosed word or phrase
preceded and followed by quotation marks
